citation.article-title: Loktanella pyoseonensis sp. nov., isolated from beach sand, and emended description of the genus Loktanella
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Loktanella Van Trappen et al. 2004
Cells are Gram-stain-negative, strictly aerobic, moderately halotolerant, chemoheterotrophic, non-spore-forming and rod-shaped.
Motility is variable among species; if observed, cells are motile by means of flagella.
Colony colours are variable (white, pink, whitish pink, beige or light orange) depending on the species.
The optimal temperature for growth is 25 °C.
The dominant fatty acid is C18 : 1ω7c.
The polar lipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylcholine and phosphatidylglycerol.
Phylogenetically, the genus belongs to the Rhodobacter group within the class Alphaproteobacteria.
The type species is Loktanella salsilacus.
